Parcel JS - Using The Docs

By Charles Loehle

Parceljs - Getting Started

  • Create a new project directory
  • Run npm init and fill out all the info it asks for
  • Install parcel-bundler with npm install --save-dev parcel-bundler
  • In package.json add these lines to "scripts":
    • 				
	"scripts": {
		"dev": "parcel src/index.html",
		"build": "parcel build src/index.html"
	},
  • Create a src folder.
  • Create index.html, index.js and script.js files inside src folder. index.js is for loading the main sass file and script.js is for regular javascript.
  • Reference index.js in index.html with a script tag before the ending body tag

SCSS

  • Install sass npm install -D sass
  • Create a .sassrc file in the root of the project and add node_modules as include path to "avoid an issue" 
    {
	"includePaths": ["node_modules"]
}
  • Create scss folder in src folder
  • Create style.scss in scss folder
  • import SCSS files in index.js 
      import './scss/style.scss'

To use sass, there are 2 ways of including it

  1. import SCSS files in index.js 
      import './scss/style.scss'
  2. Or directly include the SCSS file in index.html head.

Spin up the server

	npm run dev

At this point it should be compiling js with sass and hot reloading
